TEXT.S:
Allan Bristow
nilacul u siwkay niza u etulniza sa, u tatama ciniza, nalecuhan ciniza i 1951 a mihcaan, 8 a bulad, 23 a demiad. u miunduay a kawaw niza, namimali i Amilika NBA. i 1973 a mihcaan, mapili' ciniza nu Feichen 79 tademaw.
kakuniza kalunasulitan-sulu u sulit nu Hulam atu Amilika Â·NBA1973NBA2376 Allan Mercer Bristow, Jr. is a retired American professional basketball player, coach, and executive. Bristow played college basketball at Virginia Tech, and was selected by the Philadelphia 76ers in the second round of the 1973 NBA draft. A 6 ft 7 in, 210 lb (95 kg) forward, he had a 10-year career in both the NBA and the ABA, playing for the Sixers, the San Antonio Spurs (in both leagues), the Utah Jazz, and finishing his playing career with the Dallas Mavericks. His nickname was "Disco".
